Package ePortfolio

Class Portfolio

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Portfolio
public class Portfolio extends Object
This is a portfolio class manages a unified list of investments, provides file I/O, and allows efficient searching.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Portfolio()
    This initializes a new Portfolio with an empty list of investments and an empty keyword index.

  • Constructor Details

    • Portfolio

      public Portfolio()
      This initializes a new Portfolio with an empty list of investments and an empty keyword index.

  • Method Details

    • getInvestments

      public ArrayList<Investment> getInvestments()
      Retrieves the list of all investments in the portfolio.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of all investments currently in the portfolio.

    • getInvestmentDisplayList

      public List<String> getInvestmentDisplayList()
      Retrieves a list of display strings for all investments in the portfolio.
      Returns:
      A list of strings, each representing an investment's display information.

    • isSymbolUnique

      public boolean isSymbolUnique(String symbol)
      This checks if the given symbol is already used by any investment.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The symbol to check.
      Returns:
      True if the symbol exists, false otherwise.

    • buyInvestment

      public String buyInvestment(String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price, String type)
      This buys an investment or adds more to an existing one.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The investment's symbol.
      name - The investment's name.
      quantity - The number of shares/units to buy.
      price - The price per share/unit.
      type - The type of investment ("stock" or "mutualfund").
      Returns:
      A message indicating the success or failure of the operation.

    • sellInvestment

      public String sellInvestment(String symbol, int quantity, double price)
      This sells a specified quantity of an investment and updates the price.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The symbol of the investment to sell.
      quantity - The quantity to sell.
      price - The selling price per unit.
      Returns:
      A message indicating the success or failure of the sale.

    • addInvestment

      public void addInvestment(Investment investment)
      This adds an investment to the portfolio and indexes its keywords.
      Parameters:
      investment - The investment to be added.

    • loadInvestmentsFromFile

      public void loadInvestmentsFromFile(String filename)
      This loads investments from a specified file.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the file to load investments from.

    • saveInvestmentsToFile

      public void saveInvestmentsToFile(String filename)
      This saves all investments to a specified file in the required format.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the file to save investments to.

    • findInvestmentBySymbol

      public Investment findInvestmentBySymbol(String symbol)
      This finds an investment by its symbol.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The symbol to search for.
      Returns:
      The matching investment if found, otherwise null.

    • searchInvestment

      public List<Investment> searchInvestment(String symbol, String nameKeywords, double minPrice, double maxPrice)
      This searches for investments by symbol, keywords in name, and price range.
      Parameters:
      symbol - The symbol to search for.
      nameKeywords - The keywords to search in the name.
      minPrice - The minimum price.
      maxPrice - The maximum price.
      Returns:
      A list of investments matching the criteria.

    • updatePrices

      public void updatePrices()
      This updates the prices of all investments based on user input.

    • getGain

      public double getGain()
      This calculates the total gain of the portfolio.
      Returns:
      The total gain.

    • getIndividualGains

      public List<String> getIndividualGains()
      This will retrieve the realized gains for each individual investment in the portfolio.
      Returns:
      A list of strings, where each string contains the symbol and realized gain of an individual investment in the format: "Symbol: [symbol], Gain: $[realized gain]".

    • getAllInvestments

      public ArrayList<Investment> getAllInvestments()
      This will retrieves all investments in the portfolio.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing all Investment objects currently in the portfolio.
